publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7779 Anne McLaughlin: Community Champions from Cranhill—That the Parliament congratulates all of the winners of the Evening Times Community Champions awards; congratulates the 17-year-old Tortolano twins from Cranhill, Annemarie and Angela, on their joint award in representing young people’s issues; further congratulates Annemarie on being a finalist in the Young Individual category; recognises the value that community champions bring to their area, and welcomes this recognition of these community champions, who it considers work tirelessly to help build the communities of Cranhill and Glasgow as a wider area.
S3M-7779 Community Champions from Cranhill (lodged on 24 January 2011) Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-7779 Community Champions from Cranhill (lodged on 24 January 2011) Sandra White*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Bob Doris*
S3M-7779 Community Champions from Cranhill (lodged on 24 January 2011) Joe FitzPatrick*, Stuart McMillan*

S3M-7779 Anne McLaughlin: Community Champions from Cranhill—That the Parliament congratulates all of the winners of the Evening Times Community Champions awards; congratulates the 17-year-old Tortolano twins from Cranhill, Annemarie and Angela, on their joint award in representing young people’s issues; further congratulates Annemarie on being a finalist in the Young Individual category; recognises the value that community champions bring to their area, and welcomes this recognition of these community champions, who it considers work tirelessly to help build the communities of Cranhill and Glasgow as a wider area. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Sandra White, Alasdair Allan, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Bob Doris, Joe FitzPatrick, Stuart McMillan

S3M-7779 Anne McLaughlin: Community Champions from Cranhill—That the Parliament congratulates all of the winners of the Evening Times Community Champions awards; congratulates the 17-year-old Tortolano twins from Cranhill, Annemarie and Angela, on their joint award in representing young people’s issues; further congratulates Annemarie on being a finalist in the Young Individual category; recognises the value that community champions bring to their area, and welcomes this recognition of these community champions, who it considers work tirelessly to help build the communities of Cranhill and Glasgow as a wider area. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Sandra White, Alasdair Allan, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Bob Doris, Joe FitzPatrick, Stuart McMillan
